Others: The umpires called off India's last Group 'A' match against Canada due to a wet outfield. The match was abandoned without a ball being bowled.
India finished on top of the group with 7 points and will face Afghanistan in its first Super 8 fixture at Barbados on June 20.
Canada lost the chance to play against India and exited the tournament.
Canada head coach Pubudu Dassanayake expressed disappointment but appreciated the opportunity to interact with the Indian team.
Indian team's focus will now shift to tackling different conditions in the West Indies for the Super 8 matches.
Indian batting coach Vikram Rathour stated that it was disappointing not to get a game due to the wet outfield.
Concerns regarding sustaining injuries on a wet outfield had to be considered.
The Indian team had planned to release two travelling reserves from the squad.
